trans-unit.source: SQLite is built using a DO-178B-inspired process. The testing standards for SQLite are among the highest for commercial software.
trans-unit.target: SQLite是使用DO-178B启发的过程构建的。SQLite 的测试标准是商业软件的最高标准。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is competitive with, and usually faster than, blobs stored in separate files on disk, for both reading and writing.
trans-unit.target: SQLite与存储在磁盘上的单独文件中的blobs相比,无论是读还是写,都很有竞争力,通常也比它快。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is designed to meet most developer's needs without any changes or customization. When changes are needed, they can normally be accomplished using start-time (1) or runtime (2)(3)(4) configuration methods or via compile-time options. It is very rare that an application developer will need to edit the SQLite source code in order to incorporate SQLite into a product.
trans-unit.target: SQLite旨在满足大多数开发人员的需求，而无需进行任何更改或自定义。如果需要更改，通常可以使用开始时（1）或运行时（2）（3）（4）配置方法或通过编译时选项来完成。为了将SQLite集成到产品中，应用程序开发人员很少需要编辑SQLite源代码。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is different in that it stores the schema in the sqlite_master table as the original text of the CREATE statements that define the schema. Hence ALTER TABLE needs to revise the text of the CREATE statement. Doing so can be tricky for certain "creative" schema designs.
trans-unit.target: SQLite的不同之处在于，它将架构存储在sqlite_master表中，作为定义架构的CREATE语句的原始文本。因此，ALTER TABLE需要修改CREATE语句的文本。对于某些“创意”方案设计，这样做可能会很棘手。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is different in that it stores the schema in the sqlite_schema table as the original text of the CREATE statements that define the schema. Hence ALTER TABLE needs to revise the text of the CREATE statement. Doing so can be tricky for certain "creative" schema designs.

SQLite is expected to operate the same, and use exactly the same on-disk format, on all modern operating systems, on all modern computer architectures, and using all modern C compilers. The developers are constantly testing SQLite on as many diverse platforms as they can get their hands on.
trans-unit.target: 期望SQLite 在所有现代操作系统，所有现代计算机体系结构以及所有现代C编译器上都可以运行相同的磁盘，并且使用完全相同的磁盘格式。开发人员会不断尝试在各种平台上测试SQLite。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is in the Public Domain.
trans-unit.target: SQLite是在公共领域。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is much faster than direct writes to disk on Windows when anti-virus protection is turned on. Since anti-virus software is and should be on by default in Windows, that means that SQLite is generally much faster than direct disk writes on Windows.
trans-unit.target: 在Windows上开启防病毒保护时,SQLite比直接写入磁盘的速度要快得多。由于Windows中的防病毒软件是且应该是默认开启的,这就意味着在Windows中,SQLite的速度一般要比直接写入磁盘快很多。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is normally very forgiving about mismatches between the type of a value and the declared type of the container in which that value is to be stored. For example, SQLite allows the application to store a large BLOB in a column with a declared type of BOOLEAN. But in a few cases, SQLite is strict about types. The SQLITE_MISMATCH error is returned in those few cases when the types do not match.
trans-unit.target: SQLite通常对一个值的类型和存储该值的容器的声明类型之间的不匹配非常宽容。例如,SQLite允许应用程序在声明类型为BOOLEAN的列中存储一个大的BLOB。但在少数情况下,SQLite对类型的要求很严格。在这少数情况下,当类型不匹配时,会返回SQLITE_MISMATCH错误。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is not directly comparable to client/server SQL database engines such as MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server since SQLite is trying to solve a different problem.
trans-unit.target: SQLite不能直接与MySQL、Oracle、PostgreSQL或SQL Server等客户/服务器SQL数据库引擎相提并论,因为SQLite试图解决的是不同的问题。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is not particular about the text it receives and is more than happy to process text strings that are not normalized or even well-formed UTF-8 or UTF-16. Thus, programmers who want to store IS08859 data can do so using the UTF-8 interfaces. As long as no attempts are made to use a UTF-16 collating sequence or SQL function, the byte sequence of the text will not be modified in any way.
trans-unit.target: SQLite对接收到的文本并不特别,它非常乐意处理没有经过规范化甚至是格式良好的UTF-8或UTF-16的文本字符串。因此,想要存储IS08859数据的程序员可以使用UTF-8接口来存储。只要不尝试使用UTF-16整理序列或SQL函数,文本的字节序列就不会有任何修改。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is not particular about the text it receives and is more than happy to process text strings that are not normalized or even well-formed UTF-8 or UTF-16. Thus, programmers who want to store ISO8859 data can do so using the UTF-8 interfaces. As long as no attempts are made to use a UTF-16 collating sequence or SQL function, the byte sequence of the text will not be modified in any way.

SQLite is not the perfect application file format for every situation. But in many cases, SQLite is a far better choice than either a custom file format, a pile-of-files, or a wrapped pile-of-files. SQLite is a high-level, stable, reliable, cross-platform, widely-deployed, extensible, performant, accessible, concurrent file format. It deserves your consideration as the standard file format on your next application design.
trans-unit.target: SQLite并不是每一种情况下的完美应用文件格式。但在许多情况下,SQLite是比自定义文件格式、文件堆或包装文件堆更好的选择。SQLite是一种高级的、稳定的、可靠的、跨平台的、广泛部署的、可扩展的、高性能的、可访问的、并发的文件格式。它值得你在下一个应用程序设计中考虑将其作为标准文件格式。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is often used as the on-disk file format for desktop applications such as version control systems, financial analysis tools, media cataloging and editing suites, CAD packages, record keeping programs, and so forth. The traditional File/Open operation calls sqlite3_open() to attach to the database file. Updates happen automatically as application content is revised so the File/Save menu option becomes superfluous. The File/Save_As menu option can be implemented using the backup API.
trans-unit.target: SQLite通常用作桌面应用程序（例如版本控制系统，财务分析工具，媒体编目和编辑套件，CAD软件包，记录保存程序等）的磁盘文件格式。传统的“文件/打开”操作调用sqlite3_open（）附加到数据库文件。在修改应用程序内容时，更新会自动发生，因此“文件/保存”菜单选项将变得多余。可以使用备用API来实现File / Save_As菜单选项。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is one of many open-source projects that OSS Fuzz tests. The test/ossfuzz.c source file in the SQLite repository is SQLite's interface to OSS fuzz.
trans-unit.target: SQLite是OSS Fuzz测试的众多开源项目之一。SQLite存储库中的test / ossfuzz.c源文件是SQLite与OSS模糊测试的接口。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is one of the most used software libraries in the world. There are literally tens of billions of SQLite database files in use daily, on smartphones and gadgets and in desktop applications. SQLite is carefully tested and proven reliable. It is not a component that needs much tuning or debugging, allowing developers to stay focused on application logic.
trans-unit.target: SQLite是世界上最常用的软件库之一。每天，在智能手机和小工具以及桌面应用程序中，每天都会使用数百亿个SQLite数据库文件。SQLite 经过仔细测试并证明可靠。它不是需要大量调整或调试的组件，它使开发人员可以专注于应用程序逻辑。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is open source. This gives many people the idea that it is not well tested as commercial software and is perhaps unreliable. But that impression is false. SQLite has exhibited very high reliability in the field and a very low defect rate, especially considering how rapidly it is evolving. The quality of SQLite is achieved in part by careful code design and implementation. But extensive testing also plays a vital role in maintaining and improving the quality of SQLite. This document has summarized the testing procedures that every release of SQLite undergoes with the hope of inspiring confidence that SQLite is suitable for use in mission-critical applications.
trans-unit.target: SQLite是开源的。这给很多人的印象是,它不像商业软件那样经过很好的测试,也许是不可靠的。但这种印象是错误的。SQLite在该领域表现出了非常高的可靠性和非常低的缺陷率,尤其是考虑到它发展的速度之快。SQLite的质量部分是通过精心的代码设计和实现实现的。但广泛的测试在维护和提高SQLite质量方面也起着至关重要的作用。本文档总结了SQLite每个版本都要经历的测试过程,希望能够激发大家对SQLite适合用于关键任务应用的信心。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is required to implement atomic and durable transactions (the 'A' and 'D' from the ACID acronym), even if an application, operating system or power failure occurs midway through or shortly after updating a database file.
trans-unit.target: 即使应用程序，操作系统或电源故障在更新数据库文件的过程中或更新后不久发生，也需要SQLite来实现原子性和持久性事务（ACID缩写中的“ A”和“ D”）。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is required to implement isolated transactions (the 'I' from the ACID acronym).
trans-unit.target: 需要SQLite来实现隔离的事务（ACID缩写中的“ I”）。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is resilient in the face of corrupt inputs, including maliciously designed database files and SQL strings. Extensive fuzz-testing ensures that corrupt inputs will not lead to crashes or undefined behavior, but will instead cause sensible errors to be reported back to the application.
trans-unit.target: SQLite在面对损坏的输入时具有弹性,包括恶意设计的数据库文件和SQL字符串。广泛的模糊测试确保损坏的输入不会导致崩溃或未定义的行为,而是会导致合理的错误,并将其报告给应用程序。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is resilient in the face of corrupt inputs, including maliciously designed database files and SQL strings. Extensive fuzz-testing ensures that corrupt inputs will not lead to crashes or undefined behavior, but will instead cause sensible errors to be reported back to the application. (More...)

SQLite is slower at creating new indices. This is not a huge problem (since new indices are not created very often) but it is something that is being worked on. Hopefully, future versions of SQLite will do better here.
trans-unit.target: SQLite在创建新的索引时比较慢。这并不是一个大问题(因为新的索引并不经常创建),但这是正在解决的问题。希望未来版本的SQLite能在这方面做得更好。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is slower than the other databases when it comes to dropping tables. This probably is because when SQLite drops a table, it has to go through and erase the records in the database file that deal with that table. MySQL and PostgreSQL, on the other hand, use separate files to represent each table so they can drop a table simply by deleting a file, which is much faster.
trans-unit.target: SQLite在丢表方面比其他数据库慢。这可能是因为当SQLite丢弃一张表时,它必须去删除数据库文件中处理该表的记录。而MySQL和PostgreSQL则是用单独的文件来表示每个表,所以它们只需要删除一个文件就可以丢掉一个表,这样速度就快多了。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is threadsafe because it uses mutexes to serialize access to common data structures. However, the work of acquiring and releasing these mutexes will slow SQLite down slightly. Hence, if you do not need SQLite to be threadsafe, you should disable the mutexes for maximum performance. See the threading mode documentation for additional information.
trans-unit.target: SQLite是线程安全的，因为它使用互斥锁来序列化对常见数据结构的访问。但是，获取和释放这些互斥锁的工作会使SQLite的速度稍慢。因此，如果您不需要SQLite具有线程安全性，则应禁用互斥锁以实现最佳性能。有关其他信息，请参见线程模式文档。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is threadsafe. We make this concession since many users choose to ignore the advice given in the previous paragraph. But in order to be thread-safe, SQLite must be compiled with the SQLITE_THREADSAFE preprocessor macro set to 1. Both the Windows and Linux precompiled binaries in the distribution are compiled this way. If you are unsure if the SQLite library you are linking against is compiled to be threadsafe you can call the sqlite3_threadsafe() interface to find out.
trans-unit.target: SQLite是线程安全的。因为许多用户选择忽略上一段中的建议，所以我们做出了这一让步。但是为了确保线程安全，必须在SQLite_THREADSAFE预处理程序宏设置为1的情况下编译SQLite。Windows和Linux发行版中的预编译二进制文件都采用这种方式进行编译。如果不确定要链接的SQLite库是否已编译为线程安全的，则可以调用sqlite3_threadsafe（）接口进行查找。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is transactional, meaning that multiple changes can be grouped together such that either all or none of them occur, and so that the changes can be rolled back if a problem is found prior to commit. This allows an application to make a change incrementally, then run various sanity and consistency checks on the resulting data prior to committing the changes to disk. The Fossil DVCS uses this technique to verify that no repository history has been lost prior to each change.
trans-unit.target: SQLite是事务性的，这意味着可以将多个更改分组在一起，以使全部更改或全部不发生，并且如果在提交之前发现问题，则可以回滚更改。这使应用程序可以进行增量更改，然后在将更改提交到磁盘之前对生成的数据运行各种完整性检查和一致性检查。该化石 DVCS 使用这种技术来验证没有仓库的历史前已经向每一个变化丢失。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is typeless for the purpose of deciding what data is allowed to be stored in a column. But some notion of type comes into play when sorting and comparing data. For these purposes, a column or an expression can be one of two types: numeric and text. The sort or comparison may give different results depending on which type of data is being sorted or compared.
trans-unit.target: 为了确定允许在列中存储什么数据，SQLite是无类型的。但是，在对数据进行排序和比较时，一些类型的概念会起作用。为此，列或表达式可以是以下两种类型之一：numeric和text。根据正在排序或比较的数据类型，排序或比较可能会得出不同的结果。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is very flexible with regard to datatypes.
trans-unit.target: SQLite在数据类型方面非常灵活。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is very good at doing INSERTs within a transaction, which probably explains why it is so much faster than the other databases at this test.
trans-unit.target: SQLite非常擅长在事务中做insert,这可能解释了为什么在这次测试中它比其他数据库快很多。

trans-unit.source: SQLite is written in portable C code. Development work occurs on a mix of Linux, Mac, and Windows workstations. The developers use command-line tools and eschew integrated development environments (IDEs) whenever possible. All developers are expected to be fluent with the unix command-line.
trans-unit.target: SQLite是用可移植的C代码编写的。开发工作在 Linux、Mac 和 Windows 工作站上混合进行。开发人员使用命令行工具,尽可能避免使用集成开发环境(IDE)。所有的开发人员都需要熟练使用unix命令行。

trans-unit.source: SQLite itself does not pay any attention to environment variables in this case, though presumably the GetTempPath() system call does. The search algorithm is different for CYGWIN builds. Check the source code for details.
trans-unit.target: 在这种情况下,SQLite本身并不关注环境变量,不过据推测,GetTempPath()系统调用会关注。CYGWIN构建的搜索算法是不同的。详情请查看源代码。

trans-unit.source: SQLite itself is in the public domain and can be used for any purpose. But TH3 is proprietary and requires a license.
trans-unit.target: SQLite本身在公共领域，可以用于任何目的。但是TH3是专有的，需要许可证。

trans-unit.source: SQLite just works.
trans-unit.target: SQLite就是能用。

trans-unit.source: SQLite keeps track of the largest ROWID using an internal table named "sqlite_sequence". The sqlite_sequence table is created and initialized automatically whenever a normal table that contains an AUTOINCREMENT column is created. The content of the sqlite_sequence table can be modified using ordinary UPDATE, INSERT, and DELETE statements. But making modifications to this table will likely perturb the AUTOINCREMENT key generation algorithm. Make sure you know what you are doing before you undertake such changes. The sqlite_sequence table does not track ROWID changes associated with UPDATE statement, only INSERT statements.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用名为“ sqlite_sequence ” 的内部表来跟踪最大的ROWID 。每当创建包含AUTOINCREMENT列的普通表时，都会自动创建并初始化sqlite_sequence表。可以使用普通的UPDATE，INSERT和DELETE语句修改sqlite_sequence表的内容。但是对此表进行修改可能会扰乱AUTOINCREMENT密钥生成算法。进行此类更改之前，请确保您知道自己在做什么。 sqlite_sequence表不跟踪与UPDATE语句关联的ROWID更改，仅跟踪INSERT语句。

trans-unit.source: SQLite lets me insert a string into a database column of type integer!
trans-unit.target: SQLite让我在数据库的整数类型列中插入一个字符串!

trans-unit.source: SQLite limits the depth of recursion of triggers in order to prevent a statement involving recursive triggers from using an unbounded amount of memory.
trans-unit.target: SQLite限制了触发器的递归深度,以防止涉及递归触发器的语句使用无限制的内存。

trans-unit.source: SQLite makes a copy of the content of the sqlite3_mem_methods object so the object can be modified after the sqlite3_config() call returns.
trans-unit.target: SQLite会复制sqlite3_mem_methods对象的内容，以便可以在sqlite3_config（）调用返回后修改该对象。

trans-unit.source: SQLite makes no guarantees about the order of results if a SELECT omits the ORDER BY clause. Even so, the order of results does not change from one run to the next, and so many applications mistakenly come to depend on the arbitrary output order whatever that order happens to be. However, sometimes new versions of SQLite will contain optimizer enhancements that will cause the output order of queries without ORDER BY clauses to shift. When that happens, applications that depend on a certain output order might malfunction. By running the application multiple times with this pragma both disabled and enabled, cases where the application makes faulty assumptions about output order can be identified and fixed early, reducing problems that might be caused by linking against a different version of SQLite.
trans-unit.target: 如果一个SELECT省略了ORDER BY子句,SQLite不保证结果的顺序。即使如此,结果的顺序也不会从一次运行到下一次运行而改变,因此许多应用程序错误地依赖于任意的输出顺序,不管这个顺序是什么。然而,有时新版本的SQLite会包含优化器增强功能,会导致没有ORDER BY子句的查询的输出顺序发生变化。当发生这种情况时,依赖于某个输出顺序的应用程序可能会出现故障。通过在禁用和启用此pragma的情况下多次运行应用程序,可以及早发现并修复应用程序对输出顺序做出错误假设的情况,从而减少针对不同版本的SQLite进行链接可能导致的问题。

trans-unit.source: SQLite manipulates the contents of the file-system using a combination of the following four types of operation:
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用以下四种操作类型的组合来操作文件系统的内容。

trans-unit.source: SQLite may attempt to convert values between the storage classes INTEGER, REAL, and/or TEXT before performing a comparison. Whether or not any conversions are attempted before the comparison takes place depends on the type affinity of the operands.
trans-unit.target: 在执行比较之前,SQLite可能会尝试在存储类INTEGER、REAL和/或TEXT之间转换值。在比较发生之前是否尝试任何转换取决于操作数的类型亲和性。

trans-unit.source: SQLite may make use of transient indices to implement SQL language features such as:
trans-unit.target: SQLite可以利用瞬时索引来实现SQL语言的功能,如:。

trans-unit.source: SQLite might also add one of the following flags to the xOpen method:
trans-unit.target: SQLite也可以向xOpen方法添加以下标志之一。

trans-unit.source: SQLite might use a skip-scan on an index if it knows that the first one or more columns contain many duplication values. If there are too few duplicates in the left-most columns of the index, then it would be faster to simply step ahead to the next value, and thus do a full table scan, than to do a binary search on an index to locate the next left-column value.
trans-unit.target: 如果SQLite知道前一列或多列包含很多重复值,那么它可能会对索引使用跳过扫描。如果索引最左边的列中重复值太少,那么简单地向前迈进到下一个值,从而进行全表扫描,会比在索引上进行二进制搜索来定位下一个左列的值更快。

trans-unit.source: SQLite must see the journal files in order to recover from a crash or power failure. If the hot journal files are moved, deleted, or renamed after a crash or power failure, then automatic recovery will not work and the database may go corrupt.
trans-unit.target: SQLite必须查看日志文件才能从崩溃或电源故障中恢复。如果在崩溃或电源故障后移动，删除或重命名热日志文件，则自动恢复将不起作用，并且数据库可能会损坏。

trans-unit.source: SQLite mutexes can also be disabled at run-time using the sqlite3_config() interface. To completely disable all mutexing, the application can invoke:
trans-unit.target: 还可以在运行时使用sqlite3_config（）接口禁用SQLite互斥锁。要完全禁用所有静音，应用程序可以调用：

trans-unit.source: SQLite needs to know if the native byte order of the target CPU is big-endian or little-ending. The SQLITE_BYTEORDER preprocessor is set to 4321 for big-endian machines and 1234 for little-endian machines, or it can be 0 to mean that the byte order must be determined at run-time. There are #ifdefs in the code that set SQLITE_BYTEORDER automatically for all common platforms and compilers. However, it may be advantageous to set SQLITE_BYTEORDER appropriately when compiling SQLite for obscure targets. If the target byte order cannot be determined at compile-time, then SQLite falls back to doing run-time checks, which always work, though with a small performance penalty.
trans-unit.target: SQLite需要知道目标CPU的本机字节顺序是大恩迪还是小恩迪。SQLITE_BYTEORDER预处理程序设置为:大端机为4321,小端机为1234,也可以为0,表示必须在运行时确定字节顺序。代码中有#ifdefs可以自动设置SQLITE_BYTEORDER,适用于所有通用平台和编译器。但是,在为不明确的目标编译SQLite时,适当地设置SQLITE_BYTEORDER可能是有利的。如果在编译时无法确定目标字节顺序,那么SQLite就会退回到做运行时检查,虽然性能上会有小幅下降,但总能发挥作用。

trans-unit.source: SQLite never assumes atomic page writes in its default configurations. But a custom VFS can set one of the SQLITE_IOCAP_ATOMIC bits in the result of the xDeviceCharacteristic() method and then SQLite will assume that page writes are atomic. The application must supply a custom VFS to accomplish this, however, since none of the standard VFSes will ever set any of the atomic bits in the xDeviceCharacteristics() vector.
trans-unit.target: SQLite从未假定原子页面以其默认配置进行写入。但是自定义VFS可以在xDeviceCharacteristic（）方法的结果中设置SQLITE_IOCAP_ATOMIC位之一，然后SQLite将假定页面写入是原子的。但是，应用程序必须提供一个自定义VFS来完成此操作，因为没有一个标准VFS会设置xDeviceCharacteristics（）向量中的任何原子位。

trans-unit.source: SQLite never assumes that database page writes are atomic, regardless of the PSOW setting.<sup>(1)</sup> And hence SQLite is always able to automatically recover from torn pages induced by a crash. Enabling PSOW does not decrease SQLite's ability to recover from a torn page.
trans-unit.target: 无论PSOW设置如何，SQLite都不会假定数据库页面写操作是原子的。<sup>（1）</sup>因此，SQLite始终能够从崩溃导致的页面撕裂中自动恢复。启用PSOW不会降低SQLite从残缺页中恢复的能力。

trans-unit.source: SQLite normally stores all content in a single disk file. However, while performing a transaction, information necessary to recover the database following a crash or power failure is stored in auxiliary journal files. Such journal files are described as "hot". The journal files have the same name as the original database file with the addition of -journal or -wal suffix.
trans-unit.target: SQLite通常将所有内容存储在单个磁盘文件中。但是，在执行事务时，在崩溃或电源故障后恢复数据库所需的信息存储在辅助日志文件中。这样的日志文件被描述为“热门”。日志文件具有与原始数据库文件相同的名称，并带有 -journal 或 -wal 后缀。

trans-unit.source: SQLite now honors the UNIQUE keyword in CREATE UNIQUE INDEX. Primary keys are required to be unique.
trans-unit.target: SQLite现在在CREATE UNIQUE INDEX中使用UNIQUE关键字。主键必须是唯一的。

trans-unit.source: SQLite now implements all of its built-in functions using this interface. For additional information and examples on how to create new SQL functions, review the SQLite source code in the file func.c.
trans-unit.target: SQLite现在使用此接口实现其所有内置函数。有关如何创建新的SQL函数的其他信息和示例，请查看文件func.c中的SQLite源代码。

trans-unit.source: SQLite only supports one writer at a time per database file. But in most cases, a write transaction only takes milliseconds and so multiple writers can simply take turns. SQLite will handle more write concurrency that many people suspect. Nevertheless, client/server database systems, because they have a long-running server process at hand to coordinate access, can usually handle far more write concurrency than SQLite ever will.
trans-unit.target: SQLite每个数据库文件一次只支持一个写入器。但在大多数情况下,一个写事务只需要几毫秒,因此多个写者可以简单地轮流使用。SQLite会处理更多的写并发,这是很多人所怀疑的。尽管如此,客户机/服务器数据库系统因为有一个长期运行的服务器进程在手协调访问,通常可以处理的写并发量远远超过SQLite。

trans-unit.source: SQLite parses MATCH clauses (i.e. does not report a syntax error if you specify one), but does not enforce them. All foreign key constraints in SQLite are handled as if MATCH SIMPLE were specified.
trans-unit.target: SQLite解析MATCH子句(即如果你指定了一个子句,不会报告语法错误),但不会强制执行它们。在SQLite中,所有的外键约束都会像指定MATCH SIMPLE一样被处理。

trans-unit.source: SQLite parses expressions into a tree for processing. During code generation, SQLite walks this tree recursively. The depth of expression trees is therefore limited in order to avoid using too much stack space.
trans-unit.target: SQLite将表达式解析成一棵树进行处理。在代码生成过程中,SQLite会递归地行走这棵树。因此,表达式树的深度受到限制,以避免使用过多的堆栈空间。

trans-unit.source: SQLite processes this by gathering all the output of query and then running that output through a sorter.
trans-unit.target: SQLite的处理方式是收集查询的所有输出,然后通过分拣器运行这些输出。

trans-unit.source: SQLite provides a number of enhancements to the SQL language not normally found in other database engines. The EXPLAIN keyword and manifest typing have already been mentioned above. SQLite also provides statements such as REPLACE and the ON CONFLICT clause that allow for added control over the resolution of constraint conflicts. SQLite supports ATTACH and DETACH commands that allow multiple independent databases to be used together in the same query. And SQLite defines APIs that allows the user to add new SQL functions and collating sequences.
trans-unit.target: SQLite提供了许多其他数据库引擎中通常找不到的SQL语言增强功能。上面已经提到了EXPLAIN关键字和清单类型。 SQLite还提供诸如REPLACE和ON CONFLICT子句之类的语句，这些语句允许对约束冲突的解决方案进行附加控制。 SQLite支持ATTACH和DETACH命令，这些命令允许在同一查询中一起使用多个独立的数据库。 SQLite定义了API，这些API允许用户添加新的SQL函数和整理序列。

trans-unit.source: SQLite provides isolation between operations in separate database connections. However, there is no isolation between operations that occur within the same database connection.
trans-unit.target: SQLite提供了不同数据库连接中的操作之间的隔离。但是,在同一数据库连接中发生的操作之间没有隔离。

trans-unit.source: SQLite provides the ability for advanced programmers to exercise control over the query plan chosen by the optimizer. One method for doing this is to fudge the ANALYZE results in the sqlite_stat1, sqlite_stat3, and/or sqlite_stat4 tables. That approach is not recommended except for the one scenario described in the next paragraph.
trans-unit.target: SQLite为高级程序员提供了对优化器选择的查询计划进行控制的能力。一种执行此方法的方法是在sqlite_stat1，sqlite_stat3和/或sqlite_stat4表中捏造ANALYZE结果。除了下一段中描述的一种情况外，不建议使用该方法。

trans-unit.source: SQLite provides these two interfaces for reporting on the status of the sqlite3_malloc(), sqlite3_free(), and sqlite3_realloc() routines, which form the built-in memory allocation subsystem.
trans-unit.target: SQLite提供了这两个接口来报告sqlite3_malloc（），sqlite3_free（）和sqlite3_realloc（）例程的状态，这些例程构成了内置的内存分配子系统。

trans-unit.source: SQLite provides these two interfaces for reporting on the status of the sqlite3_malloc(), sqlite3_free(), and sqlite3_realloc() routines, which form the built-in memory allocation subsystem.
trans-unit.target: SQLite提供了这两个接口来报告sqlite3_malloc（），sqlite3_free（）和sqlite3_realloc（）例程的状态，这些例程构成了内置的内存分配子系统。

trans-unit.source: SQLite queries an implementation for file-system characteristics using the xDeviceCharacteristics() and xSectorSize() methods of the database file file-handle. These two methods are only ever called on file-handles open on database files. They are not called for
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用数据库文件文件柄的xDeviceCharacteristics()和xSectorSize()方法查询文件系统特性的实现。这两个方法只在数据库文件上打开的文件柄上被调用。它们不会被调用

trans-unit.source: SQLite reads and writes small blobs (for example, thumbnail images) 35% faster¹ than the same blobs can be read from or written to individual files on disk using fread() or fwrite().
trans-unit.target: SQLite读写小块（例如缩略图）的速度比使用fread（）或fwrite（）可以从磁盘上的单个文件读取或写入相同的blob 快35％¹。

trans-unit.source: SQLite responds gracefully to system errors. Obscure out-of-memory and I/O errors are reported back up to the application. These error reporting paths are all carefully tested to ensure they will always work.
trans-unit.target: SQLite对系统错误做出优雅的响应。晦涩的内存外和I/O错误会被报告回应用程序。这些错误报告路径都经过了仔细的测试,以确保它们始终能够工作。

trans-unit.source: SQLite seems to be a popular target for third-parties to fuzz. The developers hear about many attempts to fuzz SQLite and they do occasionally get bug reports found by independent fuzzers. All such reports are promptly fixed, so the product is improved and that the entire SQLite user community benefits. This mechanism of having many independent testers is similar to Linus's law: "given enough eyeballs, all bugs are shallow".
SQLite shall attempt to obtain an
trans-unit.target: SQLite应尝试获取一个

trans-unit.source: SQLite shall ensure that a
trans-unit.target: SQLite应确保一个

trans-unit.source: SQLite shall write the page data into the database file, using a single call to the xWrite method of the
trans-unit.target: SQLite应将页面数据写入数据库文件,只需一次调用

trans-unit.source: SQLite should never crash, overflow a buffer, leak memory, or exhibit any other harmful behavior, even when presented with maliciously malformed SQL inputs or database files. SQLite should always detect erroneous inputs and raise an error, not crash or corrupt memory. Any malfunction caused by an SQL input or database file is considered a serious bug and will be promptly addressed when brought to the attention of the SQLite developers. SQLite is extensively fuzz-tested to help ensure that it is resistant to these kinds of errors.
trans-unit.target: SQLite永远不会崩溃、溢出缓冲区、泄漏内存或表现出任何其他有害的行为,即使是在出现恶意错误的SQL输入或数据库文件时。SQLite应该始终检测到错误的输入并引发错误,而不是崩溃或破坏内存。任何由SQL输入或数据库文件引起的故障都被认为是严重的bug,当引起SQLite开发人员的注意时,会及时处理。SQLite经过了广泛的模糊测试,以帮助确保它对这类错误的抵抗力。

trans-unit.source: SQLite solves this problem by using a
trans-unit.target: SQLite通过使用

trans-unit.source: SQLite source code is managed using the Fossil version control system. Fossil was written specifically to support SQLite development. Fossil provides both distributed version control and issue tracking.
trans-unit.target: SQLite源代码使用Fossil版本控制系统进行管理。Fossil是专门为支持SQLite开发而编写的。Fossil提供了分布式版本控制和问题跟踪。

trans-unit.source: SQLite sources are maintained on three geographically dispersed servers:
trans-unit.target: SQLite源维护在三个地理上分散的服务器上。

trans-unit.source: SQLite stores an entire database within a single file, the format of which is described in the
trans-unit.target: SQLite将整个数据库存储在一个文件中,其格式描述在

trans-unit.source: SQLite strives to implement ORDER BY clauses using a preexisting index. If an appropriate index already exists, SQLite will walk the index, rather than the underlying table, to extract the requested information, and thus cause the rows to come out in the desired order. But if SQLite cannot find an appropriate index it will evaluate the query and store each row in a transient index whose data is the row data and whose key is the ORDER BY terms. After the query is evaluated, SQLite goes back and walks the transient index from beginning to end in order to output the rows in the desired order.
trans-unit.target: SQLite力求使用预先存在的索引来实现ORDER BY子句。如果已经存在一个合适的索引,SQLite将走索引,而不是走底层表,来提取请求的信息,从而使行按照所需的顺序出来。但如果SQLite找不到合适的索引,它将评估查询,并将每条记录存储在一个瞬时索引中,该索引的数据是行数据,其键是ORDER BY术语。在对查询进行评估后,SQLite会回过头来从头到尾走一遍瞬态索引,以便按照所需的顺序输出行。

trans-unit.source: SQLite strives to keep error logger traffic low and only send messages to the error logger when there really is something wrong. Applications might further cull the error message traffic by deliberately ignore certain classes of error messages that they do not care about. For example, an application that makes frequent database schema changes might want to ignore all SQLITE_SCHEMA errors.
trans-unit.target: SQLite努力使错误记录器的流量保持在较低的水平,只有当真的有问题时才向错误记录器发送消息。应用程序可能会通过故意忽略某些他们不关心的错误消息类别来进一步削减错误消息流量。例如,一个经常更改数据库模式的应用程序可能希望忽略所有SQLITE_SCHEMA错误。

trans-unit.source: SQLite strives to verify that every branch instruction makes a difference using mutation testing. A script first compiles the SQLite source code into assembly language (using, for example, the -S option to gcc). Then the script steps through the generated assembly language and, one by one, changes each branch instruction into either an unconditional jump or a no-op, compiles the result, and verifies that the test suite catches the mutation.
trans-unit.target: SQLite努力使用突变测试来验证每个分支指令是否有所作为。脚本首先将SQLite源代码编译为汇编语言（例如，使用gcc的-S选项）。然后，脚本逐步遍历生成的汇编语言，然后将每条分支指令依次更改为无条件跳转或无操作，编译结果，并验证测试套件是否捕获了突变。

trans-unit.source: SQLite supports a limited subset of ALTER TABLE. The ALTER TABLE command in SQLite allows the user to rename a table, to rename a column within a table, or to add a new column to an existing table.
trans-unit.target: SQLite支持有限的ALTER TABLE子集。SQLite中的ALTER TABLE命令允许用户重命名一个表,重命名表内的一列,或者向现有的表添加新的列。

trans-unit.source: SQLite supports an unlimited number of simultaneous readers, but it will only allow one writer at any instant in time. For many situations, this is not a problem. Writers queue up. Each application does its database work quickly and moves on, and no lock lasts for more than a few dozen milliseconds. But there are some applications that require more concurrency, and those applications may need to seek a different solution.
trans-unit.target: SQLite支持无限数量的同时读取器,但它在任何时刻都只允许一个写入器。对于很多情况来说,这不是问题。写入器排队。每个应用程序都会快速完成数据库工作并继续前进,没有一个锁的持续时间超过几十毫秒。但有些应用需要更多的并发性,这些应用可能需要寻求不同的解决方案。

trans-unit.source: SQLite supports five date and time functions as follows:
trans-unit.target: SQLite支持以下五个日期和时间函数。

trans-unit.source: SQLite supports many simple, aggregate, and window SQL functions. For presentation purposes, simple functions are further subdivided into core functions, date-time functions, and JSON functions. Applications can add new functions, written in C/C++, using the sqlite3_create_function() interface.
trans-unit.target: SQLite支持许多简单的，聚合的和窗口 SQL函数。为了便于演示，将简单函数进一步细分为核心函数，日期时间函数和JSON函数。应用程序可以使用sqlite3_create_function（）接口添加用C / C ++编写的新功能。

trans-unit.source: SQLite supports multiple simultaneous read transactions coming from separate database connections, possibly in separate threads or processes, but only one simultaneous write transaction.

SQLite supports the ability of an application to specify an alternative memory allocator at run-time by filling in an instance of the sqlite3_mem_methods object with pointers to the routines of the alternative implementation then registering the new alternative implementation using the sqlite3_config() interface. For example:
trans-unit.target: SQLite支持应用程序在运行时指定备用内存分配器的功能，方法是使用指向备用实现例程的指针填充sqlite3_mem_methods对象的实例，然后使用sqlite3_config（）接口注册新的备用实现。例如：

trans-unit.source: SQLite supports the following 11 built-in window functions:
trans-unit.target: SQLite支持以下11个内置窗口函数。

trans-unit.source: SQLite supports three different threading modes:
trans-unit.target: SQLite支持三种不同的线程模式。

trans-unit.source: SQLite tries to detect misuse and report the misuse using this result code. However, there is no guarantee that the detection of misuse will be successful. Misuse detection is probabilistic. Applications should never depend on an SQLITE_MISUSE return value.
trans-unit.target: SQLite尝试检测误用,并使用该结果代码报告误用情况。然而,并不能保证误用的检测会成功。误用检测是概率性的。应用程序永远不应该依赖SQLITE_MISUSE的返回值。

trans-unit.source: SQLite understands a real table to be a shadow table if all of the following are true:
trans-unit.target: 如果以下情况全部为真,SQLite就会将实表理解为影子表。

trans-unit.source: SQLite understands most of the standard SQL language. But it does omit some features while at the same time adding a few features of its own. This document attempts to describe precisely what parts of the SQL language SQLite does and does not support. A list of SQL keywords is also provided. The SQL language syntax is described by syntax diagrams.
trans-unit.target: SQLite理解大多数标准SQL语言。但是它确实省略了一些功能，同时又增加了一些自己的功能。本文档试图准确描述SQL语言SQLite支持和不支持的部分。还提供了SQL关键字列表。SQL语言语法由语法图描述。

trans-unit.source: SQLite understands the following binary operators, in order from highest to lowest precedence:
trans-unit.target: SQLite可以理解以下二进制运算符,按照从高到低的优先级排序。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses dynamic typing. Content can be stored as INTEGER, REAL, TEXT, BLOB, or as NULL.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用动态类型。内容可以存储为INTEGER，REAL，TEXT，BLOB或NULL。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses testcase() macros as described in the previous subsection to make sure that every condition in a bit-vector decision takes on every possible outcome. In this way, SQLite also achieves 100% MC/DC in addition to 100% branch coverage.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用上一小节中所述的 testcase() 宏来确保位向量决策中的每个条件都具有所有可能的结果。这样，除了100％的分支覆盖率之外，SQLite还可以实现100％的MC / DC。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses POSIX advisory locks to implement locking on Unix. On Windows it uses the LockFile(), LockFileEx(), and UnlockFile() system calls. SQLite assumes that these system calls all work as advertised. If that is not the case, then database corruption can result. One should note that POSIX advisory locking is known to be buggy or even unimplemented on many NFS implementations (including recent versions of Mac OS X) and that there are reports of locking problems for network filesystems under Windows. Your best defense is to not use SQLite for files on a network filesystem.
trans-unit.target: SQLite在Unix上使用POSIX咨询锁来实现锁定。在Windows上,它使用LockFile()、LockFileEx()和UnlockFile()系统调用。SQLite假设这些系统调用都能像广告中所说的那样工作。如果不是这样,那么就会导致数据库损坏。需要注意的是,在许多NFS实现上(包括Mac OS X的最新版本),POSIX咨询锁定被认为是错误的,甚至没有实现,而且有报告称Windows下的网络文件系统存在锁定问题。你最好的防御措施是不要对网络文件系统上的文件使用SQLite。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses a continuous integration process. The software is under constant enhancement and refinement. The latest trunk check-ins are frequently used internally for mission-critical operations.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用的是持续集成过程。软件在不断的增强和完善中。最新的主干检查程序经常被内部用于关键任务操作。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses a cost-based query planner. When there are two or more ways of solving the same query, SQLite tries to estimate the total amount of time needed to run the query using each plan, and then uses the plan with the lowest estimated cost. A cost is computed mostly from the estimated time, and so this case could go either way depending on the table size and what WHERE clause constraints were available, and so forth. But generally speaking, the indexed sort would probably be chosen, if for no other reason, because it does not need to accumulate the entire result set in temporary storage before sorting and thus uses much less temporary storage.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用基于成本的查询计划器。当有两种或两种以上的方法来解决同一个查询时,SQLite会尝试估计使用每种计划运行查询所需的总时间,然后使用估计成本最低的计划。成本主要是由估计的时间计算出来的,所以这种情况下可以选择任何一种方式,这取决于表的大小和有哪些where子句约束等等。但一般来说,如果没有其他原因,可能会选择索引排序,因为它不需要在排序前将整个结果集累加在临时存储中,因此使用的临时存储要少很多。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses a more general dynamic type system. In SQLite, the datatype of a value is associated with the value itself, not with its container. The dynamic type system of SQLite is backwards compatible with the more common static type systems of other database engines in the sense that SQL statements that work on statically typed databases should work the same way in SQLite. However, the dynamic typing in SQLite allows it to do things which are not possible in traditional rigidly typed databases.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用了一个更通用的动态类型系统。在SQLite中,一个值的数据类型是与值本身相关联的,而不是与它的容器相关联。SQLite的动态类型系统与其他数据库引擎的更常见的静态类型系统向后兼容,即在静态类型数据库上工作的SQL语句在SQLite中也应该以同样的方式工作。然而,SQLite中的动态类型允许它做一些在传统的刚性类型数据库中无法实现的事情。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses a page cache of recently read and written database pages. This page cache is used not just for the main database file but also for transient indices and tables stored in temporary files. If SQLite needs to use a temporary index or table and the SQLITE_TEMP_STORE compile-time parameter and the temp_store pragma are set to store temporary tables and index on disk, the information is still initially stored in memory in the page cache. The temporary file is not opened and the information is not truly written to disk until the page cache is full.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用最近读取和写入的数据库页面的页面缓存。此页面缓存不仅用于主数据库文件，还用于存储在临时文件中的临时索引和表。如果SQLite需要使用临时索引或表，并且SQLITE_TEMP_STORE编译时参数和temp_store pragma设置为在磁盘上存储临时表和索引，则该信息最初仍存储在页面缓存中的内存中。在打开页面缓存之前，不会打开临时文件，也不会真正将信息写入磁盘。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses an efficient query planner algorithm and so even a large join can be prepared quickly. Hence, there is no mechanism to raise or lower the limit on the number of tables in a join.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用高效的查询计划程序算法，因此甚至可以快速准备大型联接。因此，没有机制可以提高或降低联接中表数量的限制。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses binary arithmetic and in binary, there is no way to write 9.95 in a finite number of bits. The closest to you can get to 9.95 in a 64-bit IEEE float (which is what SQLite uses) is 9.949999999999999289457264239899814128875732421875. So when you type "9.95", SQLite really understands the number to be the much longer value shown above. And that value rounds down.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用二进制算术,在二进制中,没有办法在有限的位数中写入9.95。在64位的IEEE浮点数中,最接近9.95的数字(SQLite使用的就是这个数字)是9.9499999999999289457264239899814128875732421875。所以当你输入 "9.95 "的时候,SQLite真正理解的数字是上面显示的那个更长的值。而这个值是四舍五入的。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses dynamic memory allocation to obtain memory for storing various objects (ex: database connections and prepared statements) and to build a memory cache of the database file and to hold the results of queries. Much effort has gone into making the dynamic memory allocation subsystem of SQLite reliable, predictable, robust, secure, and efficient.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用动态内存分配来获取用于存储各种对象的内存（例如：数据库连接和准备好的语句），并为数据库文件构建内存缓存并保存查询结果。为了使SQLite的动态内存分配子系统可靠，可预测，健壮，安全和高效，已经付出了很多努力。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses dynamic run-time typing. So just because a column is declared to contain a particular type does not mean that the data stored in that column is of the declared type. SQLite is strongly typed, but the typing is dynamic not static. Type is associated with individual values, not with the containers used to hold those values.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用动态运行时类型。因此,仅仅因为一个列被声明包含一个特定的类型,并不意味着存储在该列中的数据是声明的类型。SQLite是强类型化的,但类型化是动态的而不是静态的。类型与单个值相关联,而不是与用于保存这些值的容器相关联。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses file locks on the database file, and on the write-ahead log or WAL file, to coordinate access between concurrent processes. Without coordination, two threads or processes might try to make incompatible changes to a database file at the same time, resulting in database corruption.
trans-unit.target: SQLite在数据库文件以及预写日志或WAL文件上使用文件锁来协调并发进程之间的访问。没有协调，两个线程或进程可能会尝试同时对数据库文件进行不兼容的更改，从而导致数据库损坏。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses filesystem locks to make sure that only one process and database connection is trying to modify the database at a time. The filesystem locking mechanism is implemented in the VFS layer and is different for every operating system. SQLite depends on this implementation being correct. If something goes wrong and two or more processes are able to write the same database file at the same time, severe damage can result.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用文件系统锁来确保每次只有一个进程和数据库连接试图修改数据库。文件系统锁机制是在VFS层实现的,每个操作系统都不一样。SQLite依赖于这个实现是否正确。如果出了问题,两个或更多的进程能够同时写入同一个数据库文件,就会造成严重的损失。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses one of these integer values as the second argument to calls it makes to the xLock() and xUnlock() methods of an sqlite3_io_methods object.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用这些整数值之一作为第二个参数来调用它对sqlite3_io_methods对象的xLock（）和xUnlock（）方法进行的调用。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses one of these integer values as the second argument to calls it makes to the xLock() and xUnlock() methods of an sqlite3_io_methods object.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用这些整数值之一作为第二个参数来调用它对sqlite3_io_methods对象的xLock（）和xUnlock（）方法进行的调用。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses pthreads for its mutex implementation on Unix and SQLite requires a recursive mutex. Most modern pthread implementations support recursive mutexes, but not all do. For systems that do not support recursive mutexes, it is recommended that applications operate in single-threaded mode only. If this is not possible, SQLite provides an alternative recursive mutex implementation built on top of the standard "fast" mutexes of pthreads. This alternative implementation should work correctly as long as pthread_equal() is atomic and the processor has a coherent data cache. The alternative recursive mutex implementation is enabled by the following compiler command-line switch:
trans-unit.target: SQLite在Unix上使用pthreads来实现它的mutex,而SQLite需要一个递归的mutex。大多数现代的pthread实现都支持递归mutexes,但并不是所有的pthread都支持。对于不支持递归mutexes的系统,建议应用程序只在单线程模式下运行。如果这不可能,SQLite提供了一个建立在pthreads的标准 "快速 "互斥之上的递归互斥实现。只要pthread_equal()是原子的,并且处理器有一个连贯的数据缓存,这个替代的实现就应该正确地工作。通过下面的编译器命令行开关,可以启用递归mutex的替代实现。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses reader/writer locks to control access to the database. (Under Win95/98/ME which lacks support for reader/writer locks, a probabilistic simulation is used instead.) But use caution: this locking mechanism might not work correctly if the database file is kept on an NFS filesystem. This is because fcntl() file locking is broken on many NFS implementations. You should avoid putting SQLite database files on NFS if multiple processes might try to access the file at the same time. On Windows, Microsoft's documentation says that locking may not work under FAT filesystems if you are not running the Share.exe daemon. People who have a lot of experience with Windows tell me that file locking of network files is very buggy and is not dependable. If what they say is true, sharing an SQLite database between two or more Windows machines might cause unexpected problems.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用读写器锁来控制对数据库的访问。(在Win95/98/ME不支持读写器锁的情况下,使用概率模拟来代替)。但是要注意:如果数据库文件保存在NFS文件系统上,这种锁定机制可能无法正常工作。这是因为fcntl()文件锁定在许多NFS实现上被破坏了。如果多个进程可能会同时尝试访问该文件,你应该避免将SQLite数据库文件放在NFS上。在Windows上,微软的文档说,如果你没有运行Share.exe守护程序,锁定可能在FAT文件系统下不起作用。有很多使用Windows经验的人告诉我,网络文件的文件锁定是非常错误的,而且不可靠。如果他们说的是真的,在两台或多台Windows机器之间共享SQLite数据库可能会导致意想不到的问题。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses the "file:" URI syntax to identify database files. SQLite strives to interpret file: URIs in exactly the same way as popular web-browsers such as Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Internet Explorer, and Opera, and command-line programs such as Windows "start" and the Mac OS-X "open" command. A succinct summary of the URI parsing rules follows:
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用“ file: ” URI语法来标识数据库文件。 SQLite努力以与流行的网络浏览器（例如Firefox，Chrome，Safari，Internet Explorer和Opera）以及命令行程序（例如Windows“ start”和Mac OS-X “ open）完全相同的方式解释文件URI。”命令。 URI解析规则的简要摘要如下：

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses the assumptions in this section to try to speed up reading from and writing to the database file.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用本节中的假设来尝试加快对数据库文件的读写速度。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses the following terminology:
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用以下术语。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses the fsync() system call on Unix and the FlushFileBuffers() system call on w32 in order to sync the file system buffers onto disk oxide as shown in step 3.7 and step 3.10. Unfortunately, we have received reports that neither of these interfaces works as advertised on many systems. We hear that FlushFileBuffers() can be completely disabled using registry settings on some Windows versions. Some historical versions of Linux contain versions of fsync() which are no-ops on some filesystems, we are told. Even on systems where FlushFileBuffers() and fsync() are said to be working, often the IDE disk control lies and says that data has reached oxide while it is still held only in the volatile control cache.
trans-unit.target: SQLite在Unix上使用fsync（）系统调用，在w32上使用FlushFileBuffers（）系统调用，以便将文件系统缓冲区同步到磁盘氧化物上，如步骤3.7和步骤3.10所示。不幸的是，我们收到的报告表明，这些接口在许多系统上都无法正常运行。我们听说在某些Windows版本上可以使用注册表设置完全禁用FlushFileBuffers（）。有人告诉我们，Linux的某些历史版本包含fsync（）的版本，在某些文件系统上它们是no-ops。即使在据说FlushFileBuffers（）和fsync（）工作的系统上，IDE磁盘控件也经常说谎，并说数据已经氧化，而数据仅保留在易失性控件高速缓存中。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses the fsync() system call to flush data to the disk under Unix and it uses the FlushFileBuffers() to do the same under Windows. Once again, SQLite assumes that these operating system services function as advertised. But it has been reported that fsync() and FlushFileBuffers() do not always work correctly, especially with inexpensive IDE disks. Apparently some manufactures of IDE disks have controller chips that report that data has reached the disk surface when in fact the data is still in volatile cache memory in the disk drive electronics. There are also reports that Windows sometimes chooses to ignore FlushFileBuffers() for unspecified reasons. The author cannot verify any of these reports. But if they are true, it means that database corruption is a possibility following an unexpected power loss. These are hardware and/or operating system bugs that SQLite is unable to defend against.
trans-unit.target: SQLite在Unix下使用fsync()系统调用将数据刷新到磁盘上,在Windows下使用FlushFileBuffers()也是如此。再次,SQLite假设这些操作系统服务的功能与广告中的一样。但据报道,fsync()和FlushFileBuffers()并不总是能正常工作,特别是在廉价的IDE磁盘上。很明显,一些IDE磁盘的制造商的控制器芯片会报告数据已经到达磁盘表面,而实际上数据仍然在磁盘驱动器电子元件的易失性缓存中。还有一些报告说,Windows有时会因为一些不明原因而选择忽略FlushFileBuffers()。笔者无法验证这些报道。但如果它们是真实的,那就意味着在意外断电后,数据库损坏是有可能的。这些都是SQLite无法防御的硬件和/或操作系统错误。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses the path component of the URI as the name of the disk file which contains the database. If the path begins with a '/' character, then it is interpreted as an absolute path. If the path does not begin with a '/' (meaning that the authority section is omitted from the URI) then the path is interpreted as a relative path. On windows, the first component of an absolute path is a drive specification (e.g. "C:").
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用URI的路径成分作为包含数据库的磁盘文件的名称。如果路径以'/'字符开头,那么它被解释为绝对路径。如果路径不是以'/'开头(意味着URI中省略了权限部分),那么路径被解释为相对路径。在windows中,绝对路径的第一个组成部分是驱动器规格(例如 "C:")。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses the sqlite3_value object to represent all values that can be stored in a database table. SQLite uses dynamic typing for the values it stores. Values stored in sqlite3_value objects can be integers, floating point values, strings, BLOBs, or NULL.
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用sqlite3_value对象来表示所有可以存储在数据库表中的值。SQLite对其存储的值使用动态类型。存储在 sqlite3_value 对象中的值可以是整数、浮点值、字符串、BLOBs 或 NULL。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses the xBestIndex method of a virtual table module to determine the best way to access the virtual table. The xBestIndex method has a prototype like this:
trans-unit.target: SQLite使用虚拟表模块的xBestIndex方法来确定访问虚拟表的最佳方式。xBestIndex方法的原型是这样的。

trans-unit.source: SQLite uses two defenses against this problem. In the first place, SQLite records the number of pages in the rollback journal in the header of the rollback journal. This number is initially zero. So during an attempt to rollback an incomplete (and possibly corrupt) rollback journal, the process doing the rollback will see that the journal contains zero pages and will thus make no changes to the database. Prior to a commit, the rollback journal is flushed to disk to ensure that all content has been synced to disk and there is no "garbage" left in the file, and only then is the page count in the header changed from zero to true number of pages in the rollback journal. The rollback journal header is always kept in a separate sector from any page data so that it can be overwritten and flushed without risking damage to a data page if a power outage occurs. Notice that the rollback journal is flushed to disk twice: once to write the page content and a second time to write the page count in the header.
trans-unit.target: SQLite针对这个问题使用了两种防御措施。首先,SQLite在回滚日志的页眉中记录回滚日志的页数。这个数字最初是零。因此,在尝试回滚一个不完整的(可能是损坏的)回滚日志时,进行回滚的进程将看到该日志包含零页,因此不会对数据库进行任何更改。在提交之前,回滚日志会被刷新到磁盘上,以确保所有内容都已经同步到磁盘上,并且文件中没有 "垃圾",只有在这时,日志头中的页数才会从零变为真正的回滚日志页数。回滚日志头总是与任何页面数据分开保存,以便在断电时,它可以被覆盖和刷新,而不会有损坏数据页的风险。请注意,回滚日志会两次刷新到磁盘上:一次用于写入页面内容,第二次用于写入页眉中的页数。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version
trans-unit.target: SQLite版本

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 2.8 allowed multiple simultaneous readers or a single writer but not both. SQLite version 3.0 allows one process to begin writing the database while other processes continue to read. The writer must still obtain an exclusive lock on the database for a brief interval in order to commit its changes, but the exclusive lock is no longer required for the entire write operation. A more detailed report on the locking behavior of SQLite version 3.0 is available separately.
trans-unit.target: SQLite 2.8版允许多个同时读取器或一个写入器，但不能同时使用。SQLite 3.0版允许一个进程开始写入数据库，而其他进程继续读取。编写者仍必须在短暂的时间间隔内获得数据库上的排他锁，以提交其更改，但是整个写入操作不再需要排他锁。一个更详细的报告上的SQLite的3.0版本的锁定行为是单独提供的。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 2.8 had the feature that any type of data could be stored in any table column regardless of the declared type of that column. This feature is retained in version 3.0, though in a slightly modified form. Each table column will store any type of data, though columns have an affinity for the format of data defined by their declared datatype. When data is inserted into a column, that column will make an attempt to convert the data format into the column's declared type. All SQL database engines do this. The difference is that SQLite 3.0 will still store the data even if a format conversion is not possible.
trans-unit.target: SQLite 2.8版本有一个特点,即任何类型的数据都可以存储在任何表列中,无论该列的声明类型如何。在3.0版本中保留了这一特性,不过形式略有修改。每个表列都可以存储任何类型的数据,不过列对其声明的数据类型所定义的数据格式有亲和力。当数据被插入到一个列中时,该列将尝试将数据格式转换为该列的声明类型。所有的SQL数据库引擎都会这样做。不同的是,即使无法进行格式转换,SQLite 3.0仍然会存储数据。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 2.8 will continue to be supported with bug fixes for the foreseeable future. In order to allow SQLite version 2.8 and SQLite version 3.0 to peacefully coexist, the names of key files and APIs in SQLite version 3.0 have been changed to include the character "3". For example, the include file used by C programs has been changed from "sqlite.h" to "sqlite3.h". And the name of the shell program used to interact with databases has been changed from "sqlite.exe" to "sqlite3.exe". With these changes, it is possible to have both SQLite 2.8 and SQLite 3.0 installed on the same system at the same time. And it is possible for the same C program to link against both SQLite 2.8 and SQLite 3.0 at the same time and to use both libraries at the same time.
trans-unit.target: 在可预见的未来,SQLite 2.8版本将继续支持,并进行错误修复。为了让SQLite 2.8版和SQLite 3.0版和平共处,SQLite 3.0版中的关键文件和API的名称已经被修改为包含字符 "3"。例如,C程序使用的include文件已经从 "sqlite.h "改为 "sqlite3.h"。而用于与数据库交互的shell程序的名称也从 "sqlite.exe "改为 "sqlite3.exe"。通过这些改变,可以在同一系统中同时安装SQLite 2.8和SQLite 3.0。而且同一个C程序可以同时针对SQLite 2.8和SQLite 3.0进行链接,同时使用两个库。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 2.8 will deal with data in various formats internally, but when writing to the disk or interacting through its API, SQLite 2.8 always converts data into ASCII text. SQLite 3.0, in contrast, exposes its internal data representations to the user and stores binary representations to disk when appropriate. The exposing of non-ASCII representations was added in order to support BLOBs.
trans-unit.target: SQLite 2.8版本会在内部处理各种格式的数据,但在向磁盘写入数据或通过其API进行交互时,SQLite 2.8总是将数据转换为ASCII文本。而SQLite 3.0则向用户公开其内部的数据表示,并在适当的时候将二进制表示存储到磁盘上。为了支持BLOB,增加了对非ASCII表示法的公开。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3 has the usual set of SQL comparison operators including "=", "==", "<", "<=", ">", ">=", "!=", "", "IN", "NOT IN", "BETWEEN", "IS", and "IS NOT", .
trans-unit.target: SQLite版本3具有一组常用的SQL比较运算符，包括“ =“，” ==“，” <“，” <=“，”>“，”> =“，”！=“，”“，” IN“ ，“禁止进入”，“不在”，“是”和“不是”，。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3 seeks to avoid writer starvation through the use of the PENDING lock. The PENDING lock allows existing readers to continue but prevents new readers from connecting to the database. So when a process wants to write a busy database, it can set a PENDING lock which will prevent new readers from coming in. Assuming existing readers do eventually complete, all SHARED locks will eventually clear and the writer will be given a chance to make its changes.
trans-unit.target: SQLite第3版试图通过使用PENDING锁来避免写入器饥饿。PENDING锁允许现有的读取器继续工作,但阻止新的读取器连接到数据库。因此,当一个进程想写一个繁忙的数据库时,它可以设置一个PENDING锁,这将阻止新的读者进来。假设现有的读者最终确实完成了任务,那么所有的shared锁最终都会清空,写入者将有机会进行修改。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3.0 introduces important changes to the library, including:
trans-unit.target: SQLite 3.0版本对库进行了重要的修改,包括:。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3.0 is a new version of SQLite, derived from the SQLite 2.8.13 code base, but with an incompatible file format and API. SQLite version 3.0 was created to answer demand for the following features:
trans-unit.target: SQLite 3.0版是SQLite的一个新版本,源于SQLite 2.8.13代码库,但文件格式和API不兼容。SQLite 3.0版本的创建是为了满足对以下功能的需求。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3.0 is made possible in part by AOL developers supporting and embracing great Open-Source Software.
trans-unit.target: SQLite 3.0版本之所以能够实现,部分原因是AOL开发人员支持和拥抱伟大的开源软件。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3.22.0 (2018-01-22) contains 5290 assert() macros, 839 testcase() macros, 88 ALWAYS() macros, and 63 NEVER() macros.
trans-unit.target: SQLite 3.22.0版本(2018-01-22)包含5290个assert()宏、839个testcase()宏、88个always()宏和63个neever()宏。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3.3.14 adds the concept of "Exclusive Access Mode". In exclusive access mode, SQLite retains the exclusive database lock at the conclusion of each transaction. This prevents other processes from accessing the database, but in many deployments only a single process is using a database so this is not a serious problem. The advantage of exclusive access mode is that disk I/O can be reduced in three ways:
trans-unit.target: SQLite 3.3.14版本增加了 "独占访问模式 "的概念。在独占访问模式下,SQLite在每个事务结束时都会保留独占数据库锁。这可以防止其他进程访问数据库,但在很多部署中,只有一个进程在使用数据库,所以这不是一个严重的问题。独占访问模式的优点是可以通过三种方式减少磁盘I/O。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3.5.0 (2007-09-04) introduces a new OS interface layer that is incompatible with all prior versions of SQLite. In addition, a few existing interfaces have been generalized to work across all database connections within a process rather than just all connections within a thread. The purpose of this article is to describe the changes to 3.5.0 in detail so that users of prior versions of SQLite can judge what, if any, effort will be required to upgrade to newer versions.
trans-unit.target: SQLite 3.5.0版本(2007-09-04)引入了一个新的操作系统接口层,该接口层与SQLite之前的所有版本都不兼容。此外,一些现有的接口已经被泛化,以工作在一个进程内的所有数据库连接上,而不仅仅是线程内的所有连接。本文的目的是详细描述3.5.0的变化,以便SQLite以前版本的用户可以判断升级到新版本需要做哪些工作(如果有的话)。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3.6.0 (2008-07-16) contains many changes. As is the custom with the SQLite project, most changes are fully backwards compatible. However, a few of the changes in version 3.6.0 are incompatible and might require modifications to application code and/or makefiles. This document is a briefing on the changes in SQLite 3.6.0 with special attention to the incompatible changes.
trans-unit.target: SQLite 3.6.0 (2008-07-16)版本包含了许多变化。按照SQLite项目的惯例,大多数变化是完全向后兼容的。然而,3.6.0版本中的一些变化是不兼容的,可能需要修改应用程序代码和/或makefile。这篇文档是对SQLite 3.6.0中的变化的简要介绍,其中特别注意了不兼容的变化。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3.7.0 introduced a number of new enhancements to the SQLite database file format (such as but not limited to WAL). The 3.7.0 release was a shake-out release for these new features. We expected to find problems and were not disappointed.
trans-unit.target: SQLite版本3.7.0对SQLite数据库文件格式（例如但不限于WAL）引入了许多新的增强功能。3.7.0版本是这些新功能的淘汰版本。我们希望发现问题，并且不会感到失望。

trans-unit.source: SQLite version 3.7.16.2 fixes a subtle race condition in the locking logic on Windows systems. When a database file is in need of recovery because the previous process writing to it crashed in the middle of a transaction and two or more processes try to open the that database at the same time, then the race condition might cause one of those processes to get a false indication that the recovery has already completed, allowing that process to continue using the database file without running recovery first. If that process writes to the file, then the file might go corrupt. This race condition had apparently existed in all prior versions of SQLite for Windows going back to 2004. But the race was very tight. Practically speaking, you need a fast multi-core machine in which you launch two processes to run recovery at the same moment on two separate cores. This defect was on Windows systems only and did not affect the posix OS interface.
trans-unit.target: SQLite 3.7.16.2版本修复了Windows系统上锁定逻辑中一个微妙的竞赛条件。当一个数据库文件需要恢复时,因为前一个向它写入数据的进程在事务中间崩溃了,而两个或更多的进程同时试图打开该数据库,那么竞赛条件可能会导致其中一个进程得到一个错误的指示,即恢复已经完成,允许该进程继续使用数据库文件而不首先运行恢复。如果该进程对文件进行写入,那么文件可能会损坏。这种竞赛条件显然已经存在于所有先前版本的SQLite for Windows中,可以追溯到2004年。但竞赛非常激烈。实际上,你需要一台快速的多核机器,在这台机器中,你需要在两个独立的核心上同时启动两个进程来运行恢复。这个缺陷只出现在Windows系统上,并没有影响到posix操作系统的界面。

trans-unit.source: SQLite was originally coded in such a way that the answer to all questions in the chart below would be "Yes". But the experiments run on other SQL engines showed that none of them worked this way. So SQLite was modified to work the same as Oracle, PostgreSQL, and DB2. This involved making NULLs indistinct for the purposes of the SELECT DISTINCT statement and for the UNION operator in a SELECT. NULLs are still distinct in a UNIQUE column. This seems somewhat arbitrary, but the desire to be compatible with other engines outweighed that objection.
trans-unit.target: SQLite最初的编码方式是,下图中所有问题的答案都是 "是"。但在其他SQL引擎上运行的实验表明,它们都不是这样工作的。因此,SQLite被修改成和Oracle、PostgreSQL和DB2一样的工作方式。这包括使NULLs在SELECT DISTINCT语句和SELECT中的UNION操作符中是不区分的。在UNIQUE列中,NULLs仍然是不同的。这似乎有些武断,但与其他引擎兼容的愿望超过了这个反对意见。

trans-unit.source: SQLite was originally designed with a policy of avoiding arbitrary limits. Of course, every program that runs on a machine with finite memory and disk space has limits of some kind. But in SQLite, those limits were not well defined. The policy was that if it would fit in memory and you could count it with a 32-bit integer, then it should work.
trans-unit.target: SQLite最初的设计方针是避免任意限制。当然,每一个运行在内存和磁盘空间有限的机器上的程序都有某种限制。但在SQLite中,这些限制并没有很好的定义。政策是,如果它能装进内存,而且你能用一个32位的整数来计算,那么它应该可以工作。

trans-unit.source: SQLite was tested in the same configuration that it appears on the website. It was compiled with -O6 optimization and with the -DNDEBUG=1 switch which disables the many "assert()" statements in the SQLite code. The -DNDEBUG=1 compiler option roughly doubles the speed of SQLite.
trans-unit.target: SQLite的测试与网站上的配置相同。它是在-O6优化和-DNDEBUG=1开关的情况下编译的,该开关禁用了SQLite代码中的许多 "assert()"语句。-DNDEBUG=1编译器选项大约使SQLite的速度提高了一倍。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will also add one of the following flags to the xOpen() call, depending on the object being opened:
trans-unit.target: SQLite还将根据被打开的对象,在xOpen()调用中添加以下标志之一。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will also attempt to use indices to help satisfy GROUP BY clauses and the DISTINCT keyword. If the nested loops of the join can be arranged such that rows that are equivalent for the GROUP BY or for the DISTINCT are consecutive, then the GROUP BY or DISTINCT logic can determine if the current row is part of the same group or if the current row is distinct simply by comparing the current row to the previous row. This can be much faster than the alternative of comparing each row to all prior rows.
trans-unit.target: SQLite也会尝试使用索引来帮助满足GROUP BY子句和DISTINCT关键字。如果连接的嵌套循环可以被安排成对GROUP BY或DISTINCT来说是等价的行是连续的,那么GROUP BY或DISTINCT逻辑就可以简单地通过比较当前行和前一条行来确定当前行是否是同一组的一部分,或者当前行是否是不同的。这比将每条记录与之前的所有记录进行比较要快得多。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will always allocate at least mxPathname+1 bytes for the output buffer xFullPathname. The exact size of the output buffer is also passed as a parameter to both methods. If the output buffer is not large enough, SQLITE_CANTOPEN should be returned. Since this is handled as a fatal error by SQLite, vfs implementations should endeavor to prevent this by setting mxPathname to a sufficiently large value.
trans-unit.target: SQLite将始终至少为输出缓冲区xFullPathname分配mxPathname + 1字节。输出缓冲区的确切大小也作为参数传递给这两种方法。如果输出缓冲区不够大，则应返回SQLITE_CANTOPEN。由于这是SQLite处理的致命错误，因此vfs实现应通过将mxPathname设置为足够大的值来努力防止这种情况的发生。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will always allocate at least mxPathname+1 bytes for the output buffer xFullPathname. The exact size of the output buffer is also passed as a parameter to both methods. If the output buffer is not large enough, SQLITE_CANTOPEN should be returned. Since this is handled as a fatal error by SQLite, vfs implementations should endeavor to prevent this by setting mxPathname to a sufficiently large value.
trans-unit.target: SQLite将始终至少为输出缓冲区xFullPathname分配mxPathname + 1字节。输出缓冲区的确切大小也作为参数传递给这两种方法。如果输出缓冲区不够大，则应返回SQLITE_CANTOPEN。由于这是SQLite处理的致命错误，因此vfs实现应通过将mxPathname设置为足够大的值来努力防止这种情况的发生。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will invoke the xMutexEnd() method when sqlite3_shutdown() is called, but only if the prior call to xMutexInit returned SQLITE_OK. If xMutexInit fails in any way, it is expected to clean up after itself prior to returning.
trans-unit.target: 当调用sqlite3_shutdown（）时，SQLite将调用xMutexEnd（）方法，但前提是先前对xMutexInit的调用返回了SQLITE_OK。如果xMutexInit发生任何故障，则应先清除后再返回。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will invoke the xMutexEnd() method when sqlite3_shutdown() is called, but only if the prior call to xMutexInit returned SQLITE_OK. If xMutexInit fails in any way, it is expected to clean up after itself prior to returning.
trans-unit.target: 当调用sqlite3_shutdown（）时，SQLite将调用xMutexEnd（）方法，但前提是先前对xMutexInit的调用返回了SQLITE_OK。如果xMutexInit发生任何故障，则应先清除后再返回。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will make this determination, but only if it has been compiled with SQLITE_ENABLE_STAT3 or SQLITE_ENABLE_STAT4. The SQLITE_ENABLE_STAT3 and SQLITE_ENABLE_STAT4 options causes the ANALYZE command to collect a histogram of column content in the sqlite_stat3 or sqlite_stat4 tables and to use this histogram to make a better guess at the best query to use for range constraints such as the above. The main difference between STAT3 and STAT4 is that STAT3 records histogram data for only the left-most column of an index whereas STAT4 records histogram data for all columns of an index. For single-column indexes, STAT3 and STAT4 work the same.
trans-unit.target: SQLite将做出此确定，但前提是已使用SQLITE_ENABLE_STAT3或SQLITE_ENABLE_STAT4进行了编译。该SQLITE_ENABLE_STAT3和SQLITE_ENABLE_STAT4选项导致ANALYZE命令收集的列内容直方图sqlite_stat3或sqlite_stat4表和使用该直方图，使在要使用范围约束最佳的查询更好的猜测，如上述。 STAT3和STAT4之间的主要区别在于STAT3仅记录索引的最左列的直方图数据，而STAT4记录索引的所有列的直方图数据。对于单列索引，STAT3和STAT4的工作原理相同。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will never invoke xInit() more than once without an intervening call to xShutdown().
trans-unit.target: 在没有调用xShutdown()的情况下,SQLite绝不会多次调用xInit()。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will normally invoke xFetch() with a createFlag of 0 or 1. SQLite will only use a createFlag of 2 after a prior call with a createFlag of 1 failed. In between the to xFetch() calls, SQLite may attempt to unpin one or more cache pages by spilling the content of pinned pages to disk and synching the operating system disk cache.
trans-unit.target: SQLite通常会以0或1的createFlag调用xFetch()。SQLite只有在之前的createFlag为1的调用失败后才会使用createFlag为2。在调用to xFetch()之间,SQLite可能会尝试取消一个或多个缓存页的钉钉,将被钉钉的页面内容洒到磁盘上,并同步操作系统的磁盘缓存。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will normally invoke xFetch() with a createFlag of 0 or 1. SQLite will only use a createFlag of 2 after a prior call with a createFlag of 1 failed. In between the xFetch() calls, SQLite may attempt to unpin one or more cache pages by spilling the content of pinned pages to disk and synching the operating system disk cache.

SQLite will normally work fine as the database backend to a website. But if the website is write-intensive or is so busy that it requires multiple servers, then consider using an enterprise-class client/server database engine instead of SQLite.
trans-unit.target: 一般情况下,SQLite作为网站的数据库后端可以正常工作。但如果网站是写密集型的,或者非常繁忙,需要多台服务器,那么可以考虑使用企业级客户/服务器数据库引擎来代替SQLite。

trans-unit.source: SQLite will still omit the sorting step. But in order for output to appear in the correct order, SQLite will do the table scan starting at the end and working toward the beginning, rather than starting at the beginning and working toward the end as shown in figure 17.
trans-unit.target: SQLite仍将省略排序步骤。但是为了使输出以正确的顺序出现，SQLite将从表的末尾开始到表头开始进行表扫描，而不是如图17所示从表头开始到末尾进行表扫描。

trans-unit.source: SQLite works best if you group multiple operations together into a single transaction.
trans-unit.target: 如果将多个操作集中到一个事务中,SQLite的效果最好。

trans-unit.source: SQLite works by compiling SQL text into bytecode, then running that bytecode using a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: SQLite的工作方式是将SQL文本编译为字节码，然后使用虚拟机运行该字节码。

trans-unit.source: SQLite works by translating SQL statements into bytecode and then running that bytecode in a virtual machine. This document describes how how the bytecode engine works.
trans-unit.target: SQLite的工作原理是将SQL语句翻译成字节码,然后在虚拟机中运行该字节码。本文档介绍了字节码引擎是如何工作的。

trans-unit.source: SQLite works by translating each SQL statement into bytecode and then running that bytecode. A prepared statement in SQLite is mostly just the bytecode needed to implement the corresponding SQL. The sqlite3_prepare_v2() interface is a compiler that translates SQL into bytecode. The sqlite3_step() interface is the virtual machine that runs the bytecode contained within the prepared statement.
trans-unit.target: SQLite的工作方式是将每个SQL语句转换为字节码，然后运行该字节码。一个事先准备好的声明中SQLite是大多只是来执行相应的SQL所需的字节码。该sqlite3_prepare_v2（）接口是SQL转换成字节码编译器。的sqlite3_step（）接口是运行包含在内的字节代码的虚拟机准备的语句。

trans-unit.source: SQLite works great as the database engine for most low to medium traffic websites (which is to say, most websites). The amount of web traffic that SQLite can handle depends on how heavily the website uses its database. Generally speaking, any site that gets fewer than 100K hits/day should work fine with SQLite. The 100K hits/day figure is a conservative estimate, not a hard upper bound. SQLite has been demonstrated to work with 10 times that amount of traffic.
trans-unit.target: SQLite作为大多数中低流量网站(也就是大多数网站)的数据库引擎非常好用。SQLite能够处理的网络流量取决于网站对其数据库的使用程度。一般来说,任何点击率低于100K/天的网站都应该可以使用SQLite。100K点击率/天的数字是一个保守的估计,而不是一个硬性的上限。SQLite已经被证明可以在10倍于这个流量的情况下工作。

trans-unit.source: SQLite's Built-in printf()
trans-unit.target: SQLite的内置printf（）

trans-unit.source: SQLite's Built-in printf()
trans-unit.target: SQLite的内置printf()

trans-unit.source: SQLite, in contrast, stores all content in a single file on disk. That single file is something you can point to and say "this is the database". It behaves as an object. An SQLite database file can be copied, renamed, sent as an email attachment, passed as the argument a POST HTTP request, or otherwise treated as other data object such as an image, document, or media file.
trans-unit.target: 相反，SQLite将所有内容存储在磁盘上的单个文件中。您可以指向该文件，然后说“这是数据库”。它表现为一个对象。 SQLite数据库文件可以被复制，重命名，作为电子邮件附件发送，作为POST HTTP请求的参数传递，或者被视为其他数据对象，例如图像，文档或媒体文件。

trans-unit.source: SQLite, in contrast, use only the amount of disk space actually needed to store the information in a row. If you store a single character in a VARCHAR(100) column, then only a single byte of disk space is consumed. (Actually two bytes - there is some overhead at the beginning of each column to record its datatype and length.)
trans-unit.target: 而SQLite则只使用实际需要的磁盘空间来存储一行的信息。如果你在VARCHAR(100)列中存储一个字符,那么只消耗一个字节的磁盘空间。(实际上是两个字节--在每一列的开头有一些开销来记录其数据类型和长度)。

trans-unit.source: SQLite, like all SQL database engines, makes extensive use of malloc() (See the separate report on dynamic memory allocation in SQLite for additional detail.) On servers and workstations, malloc() never fails in practice and so correct handling of out-of-memory (OOM) errors is not particularly important. But on embedded devices, OOM errors are frighteningly common and since SQLite is frequently used on embedded devices, it is important that SQLite be able to gracefully handle OOM errors.
trans-unit.target: 与所有SQL数据库引擎一样，SQLite广泛使用了malloc（）（有关其他详细信息，请参见SQLite中有关动态内存分配的单独报告。）在服务器和工作站上，malloc（）在实践中绝不会失败，因此正确处理外发-内存错误（OOM）并不是特别重要。但是在嵌入式设备上，OOM错误非常普遍，并且由于SQLite经常在嵌入式设备上使用，因此SQLite能够妥善处理OOM错误非常重要。

trans-unit.source: SQLite: Single File Database
trans-unit.target: SQLite:单文件数据库

trans-unit.source: Safe languages are often touted for helping to prevent security vulnerabilities. True enough, but SQLite is not a particularly security-sensitive library. If an application is running untrusted and unverified SQL, then it already has much bigger security issues (SQL injection) that no "safe" language will fix.
trans-unit.target: 安全语言经常被吹捧为有助于防止安全漏洞。的确如此,但SQLite并不是一个特别安全敏感的库。如果一个应用程序正在运行不受信任和未经验证的SQL,那么它已经存在更大的安全问题(SQL注入),任何 "安全 "语言都无法解决。

trans-unit.source: Safe languages insert additional machine branches to do things like verify that array accesses are in-bounds. In correct code, those branches are never taken. That means that the machine code cannot be 100% branch tested, which is an important component of SQLite's quality strategy.
trans-unit.target: 安全语言会插入额外的机器分支来做一些事情,比如验证数组访问是否在界内。在正确的代码中,这些分支永远不会被采取。这意味着机器代码不能100%地进行分支测试,这是SQLite质量策略的一个重要组成部分。

trans-unit.source: Safe languages usually want to abort if they encounter an out-of-memory (OOM) situation. SQLite is designed to recover gracefully from an OOM. It is unclear how this could be accomplished in the current crop of safe languages.

Safe languages usually want to abort if they encounter an out-of-memory (OOM) situation. SQLite is designed to recovery gracefully from an OOM. It is unclear how this could be accomplished in the current crop of safe languages.
trans-unit.target: 安全语言如果遇到内存不足(OOM)的情况,通常会想要中止。SQLite被设计成可以从OOM中优雅地恢复。目前还不清楚如何在当前的安全语言中实现这一点。

trans-unit.source: Safe programming languages solve the easy problems: memory leaks, use-after-free errors, array overruns, etc. Safe languages provide no help beyond ordinary C code in solving the rather more difficult problem of computing a correct answer to an SQL statement.
trans-unit.target: 安全编程语言解决的是容易的问题:内存泄漏、用后免责错误、数组超限等。安全语言除了普通的C代码外,在解决计算SQL语句的正确答案这个比较困难的问题时,没有提供任何帮助。

trans-unit.source: Safety-critical applications will usually want to modify the default lookaside memory configuration so that when the initial lookaside memory buffer is allocated during sqlite3_open() the resulting memory allocation is not so large as to force the n parameter to be too large. In order to keep n under control, it is best to try to keep the largest memory allocation below 2 or 4 kilobytes. Hence, a reasonable default setup for the lookaside memory allocator might any one of the following:
trans-unit.target: 对安全性有严格要求的应用程序通常会希望修改默认的后备内存配置，以便在sqlite3_open（）期间分配初始后备内存缓冲区时，所得的内存分配不会太大，以至于无法强制n参数太大。为了使n受控制，最好尝试将最大的内存分配保持在2或4 KB以下。因此，后备内存分配器的合理默认设置可能是以下任何一种：

trans-unit.source: Segment b-trees are prefix-compressed b+-trees. There is one segment b-tree for each row in the %_segdir table (see above). The root node of the segment b-tree is stored as a blob in the "root" field of the corresponding row of the %_segdir table. All other nodes (if any exist) are stored in the "blob" column of the %_segments table. Nodes within the %_segments table are identified by the integer value in the blockid field of the corresponding row. The following table describes the fields of the %_segdir table:
trans-unit.target: 分段b树是前缀压缩的b+树。在%_segdir表中,每一行都有一个b段树(见上文)。分段b树的根节点以blob的形式存储在%_segdir表中相应行的 "root "字段中。所有其他的节点(如果有的话)都存储在%_segments表的 "blob "列中。%_segments表中的节点由相应行的blockid字段中的整数值来标识。下表描述了%_segdir表的字段。

trans-unit.source: Session objects created using this function should be deleted using the sqlite3session_delete() function before the database handle that they are attached to is itself closed. If the database handle is closed before the session object is deleted, then the results of calling any session module function, including sqlite3session_delete() on the session object are undefined.
trans-unit.target: 使用此函数创建的会话对象应该在关闭与其关联的数据库句柄之前使用sqlite3session_delete（）函数删除。如果在删除会话对象之前关闭数据库句柄，则未定义调用任何会话模块函数（包括会话对象上的sqlite3session_delete（））的结果。

trans-unit.source: Session objects created using this function should be deleted using the sqlite3session_delete() function before the database handle that they are attached to is itself closed. If the database handle is closed before the session object is deleted, then the results of calling any session module function, including sqlite3session_delete() on the session object are undefined.
trans-unit.target: 使用此函数创建的会话对象应该在关闭与其关联的数据库句柄之前使用sqlite3session_delete（）函数删除。如果在删除会话对象之前关闭数据库句柄，则未定义调用任何会话模块函数（包括会话对象上的sqlite3session_delete（））的结果。

trans-unit.source: Session objects must be deleted before the database handle to which they are attached is closed. Refer to the documentation for sqlite3session_create() for details.
trans-unit.target: 在关闭会话对象所连接的数据库句柄之前，必须将其删除。有关详细信息，请参考sqlite3session_create（）的文档。

trans-unit.source: Session objects must be deleted before the database handle to which they are attached is closed. Refer to the documentation for sqlite3session_create() for details.
trans-unit.target: 在关闭会话对象所连接的数据库句柄之前，必须将其删除。有关详细信息，请参考sqlite3session_create（）的文档。

trans-unit.source: Set *pnInst to the total number of occurrences of all phrases within the query within the current row. Return SQLITE_OK if successful, or an error code (i.e. SQLITE_NOMEM) if an error occurs.
trans-unit.target: 将*pnInst设置为当前行内查询中所有短语的总出现次数。如果查询成功,返回SQLITE_OK,如果出现错误,返回错误代码(即SQLITE_NOMEM)。

trans-unit.target: 设置或清除间接变化标志

trans-unit.target: 在会话对象上设置一个表格过滤器
